featureType.name: qgis_irmt_5a92c817_46c7_4fce_8aa8_c893a3178f24
featureType.title: SARA_Peru_Risk_Integrated_27122015
featureType.abstract: The following is an integrated earthquake risk assessment for Peru at the Distrito (P3) level of geography. This assessment is a "work in progress" as weights will be applied to the data. The latter is being conducted within the respective country. Integrated risk is defined here as the combination of average annual losses to residential infrastructure with a composite index of social vulnerability. A composite index of social vulnerability is a combination of data that aims to measure characteristics within social systems that create the potential for loss and the differential ability to mitigate, respond to, and recover from damaging earthquake events. An integrated risk index provides a "broad brush" approach to highlighting areas where earthquake losses are most likely to occur coupled with the location of populations that are least likely to be able to be able to cope with such losses.
